title: Full Functions Support: @dotdo/functions + functions.do
description:
@dotdo/functions needs to support all 4 function models (Code, Generative, Agentic, Human). functions.do is the managed implementation.

## Current State
- core/ has type definitions for all 4 paradigms
- Main src/ has complex code-function-only runtime (~11K lines)
- Depends on primitives.org.ai packages but doesn't fully integrate them

## Goal
1. @dotdo/functions (core package) - complete type definitions + exports
2. functions.do - managed runtime that executes all 4 function types

## Function Types
| Type | Timeout | Implementation |
|------|---------|----------------|
| Code | 5s | Worker Loader, WASM, ai-evaluate |
| Generative | 30s | ai-functions primitives |
| Agentic | 5m | autonomous-agents |
| Human | 24h | human-in-the-loop, digital-workers |

## Architecture
- Cascade execution auto-escalates through tiers
- Unified routing via digital-workers
- functions.do provides the managed edge runtime

title: [Spike] Distributed .NET runtime - Core + specialized workers
description: Explore breaking .NET into multiple specialized runtime workers: Core (base CLR), Web (ASP.NET), Data (EF Core), ML (ML.NET). Each worker stays warm via sharding. Functions compose capabilities via capnweb RPC.

title: P0: Fix vitest parallelism consuming 100GB+ RAM
description: CRITICAL: vitest-pool-workers spawns too many workerd processes consuming 100GB+ RAM. Need to configure vitest to limit parallelism.
